Articles.Content:
I can't get antialiasing to work, no matter which settings I'm using.

I use Windows 8 (With all latest patches) with GeForce GTX 760 (With latest drivers - currently 344.11), with lots of RAM, running 32bit KSP, and no mods. All graphics options are set to their max (And I've tried lowering or disabling some of them at different times), but picture quality is not good:

Note artifacts on the left (Circled) in background, the kerbal's mouth, and most of the borders on the ship on the right. The effects when the models move are much worse. Same issues are in-game as well.

I get this for both windowed or full-screen, with ksp version 0.24.2.559 (both 32 and 64 bits).

System info from ksp.log:

Kerbal Space Program - 0.24.2.559 (WindowsPlayer)



OS: Windows 8.1  (6.3.9600) 64bit
CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4820K CPU @ 3.70GHz (8)
RAM: 8134
GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 760 (3072MB)
SM: 30 (Direct3D 9.0c [nvd3dum.dll 9.18.13.4411])
RT Formats: ARGB32, Depth, ARGBHalf, RGB565, Default, DefaultHDR, ARGBFloat, RGFloat, RGHalf, RFloat, RHalf, R8

What am I missing?

Thanks!
Are you referring this? Perhaps, you might want to look into other graphic setting.

That's not an AA problem, looks like artifacts (of which KSP has a few now and again).

EDIT: You realize it's artifacts, but they're not caused by an AA problem. :-)

Well, it walks like AA and quacks like AA.

Any way to fix this, whatever it is?

Welcome to KSP.

Wait until you get a look at the edges of the skybox.

When you see it, you'll sh1t bricks.
I think that is related to the double parts issue. I had the same experience until I removed the gamedata/squad/parts folder and re-patched. All the textures look find now.

Hmm. I don't remember off hand if the G-Force Experience software has selectable AA options. If you haven't try to turn OFF the AA in KSP. Sometimes the double AA accomplished by the game and by the video card interfere with each other. If it's already off in game, then try swapping the settings.

Good luck,

~Claw
